title: Things to Do Summer 2007
name: Things to Do Summer 2007
description:
A Map by Tracy_the_astonishing

Trying to organize summer.

properties.name: ✓ Boredoms concert with Birgit and Sam July 7, 2007, 4pm
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   Update: I went to this, but the line was so slow and long that I didn\'t want to wait in it with Vigo, so I took him down to the river to get ice cream. I missed my opprtunity to get in with Erik and Birgit and Sam, and took Vigo for a long walk down to the beach at the Brooklyn Bridge Park. The pool was closed due to infant feces (gross) but we had a nice time hanging out on the sand. When we came back, the show was still going on so we listened outside for a while and then went to get some sushi and wait for the rest of our gang. I think Vigo would have enjoyed the show and I\'m disappointed that I missed it. ********************* Celebrating their 20th anniversary, the legendary Japanese avant-garde rock band the Boredoms will debut 77 DRUM on 07/07/07 on the lawn of the Empire-Fulton Ferry State Park section of Brooklyn Bridge Park. The band will lead 77 drummers in a once-in-a-lifetime performance. 4pm until dusk. FREE! RSVP required: http://www.viceland.com/77boadrum/ Shannon Mayers 718-802-0603 x19 smayers@bbpc.net

properties.name: ✓ Brunar Family Vacation, 2007
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing Hattaras, NC

properties.name: ✓ Camping Trip in Maine July 13-15, 2007
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  Bar Harbor, MaineThis was a pretty great trip. Dragon was visiting from Iowa and Justine and Micheal decided to join us. We stayed at the KOA, which was sort of a mistake. We could have stayed at the State Park instead. Dragon made some friends at the campground. Making friends being his top skill. For weeks before even coming to Boston, he had been talking about wanting to swim in the Atlantic Ocean, and Maine was his chance. We went to the beach, where the water temperature was a chilly 57 degrees Farenheit (Brrrr), but he and Erik really swam and dodged the waves. They made it look so fun, that they inspired a bunch of other people to brave the cold and get in there, too. Here\'s the video of Dargon\'s first dip in the Atlantic: . Vigo also had a great time on the beach We had a better swimming experience at the lake, and Dragon got sick of me filming and photographing him. Last video is Vigo with some ducks

properties.name: ✓ Dragon's Visit. July 5-25, 2007
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingSomerville, MAIt was so fun having Dragon around. He\'s such a nice kid. While he was here, we spent a weekend in NYC, went camping in Maine, and went to the Harry Potter 7 release party. By the end of the three weeks, he was eager to get back to his friends and to football and to his family. Not necessarily in that order.

properties.name: ✓ Family Reunion, July 27-29, 2007
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   This will be vigo\'s first time experiencing the big Rolling family reunion. My dad said that it\'s not quite as big as it used to be. Only about 100 or so people showed up last year. Still, it\'s a pretty fun party and it\'s a neet feeling to meet all these people who are related to you. I think Vigo is going to love it.

properties.name: ✓ Go to the Office June 4-8, 2007
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing404 NW 10th Ave, Portland, OR

properties.name: ✓ Harbor Islands camping Trip, August 11-12, 2007
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  This year we went back again to Lovell\'s and were lucky enough to get a spot on our favorite tip on the island. We met a guy who had been camping on the islands with his boat for months. He was a photographer and he was running almost exclusively on solar power. We only stayed one night this year, which is really too short. Getting out there is such an effort that you really want more time before lugging all the stuff back again. Vigo and I made some time-lapse style videos which was pretty fun.

properties.name: ✓ Platial Abroad August 13-26, 2007
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingSan Miguel del Allende, MexicoProving that an internet company can indeed work from anywhere in the world, four of us traveled to San Miguel de Allende. We worked like mad but didn\'t neglect to take time off for adventures and partying. We stopped to have a beer one Saturday at this cute little hotel. While Emi was enjoying the pool, this song came over the ipod poolside sound system....

properties.name: ✓ Stay Home and Enjoy the Pool, August 2007
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 98 Oxford St, somerville, MAOur new apartment has a big, above-ground pool in the back yard. Our friend\'s daughter is coming from Paris to be our nanny in August. This is the month for relaxing. UPDATE Erik, Vigo, and Gloria certainly did stay home and relax and enjoy the pool, but I traveled to Mexico for twoo weeks in the middle of August and the time went by so fast!

properties.name: ✓ Take Care of Business June 3-6, 2007
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingParis, FranceErik will fly in and out of Paris.

properties.name: ✓ Try to buy a Little Apartment June 6-18, 2007
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingberlin, germanyUpdate: Erik didn\'t manage to actually buy an apartment while he was in Berlin, but he did fall in love with the city. Starting again in the fall, we\'ll be looking at real estate there. We realize that this is a kind of crazy idea, but we want to go to Berlin and try to buy a tiny little apartment there. Erik is going alone.

properties.name: ✓ Visit Brent and Serena, May 7-14, 2007
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   Todos Santos, MexicoVacation! This was a wonderful vacation. I drew every day. I went to the beach. I spent a night in la Paz. I got to hang out with good friends. Highlights of the trip include Serena bringing her lettuce sprouts with us to La Paz to keep them watered and happy, having the hotel rooftop bar all to ourselves in La Paz, Brent\'s cooking, the rocky beach, making up stories about the ruins of the old cannery, and all of the hanging out. See all the pictures from my vacation

properties.name: ✓ Visit Tali and Kyle. April 14-22, 2007
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingNew York, NYSee some pictures. We had a great time with Tali and Kyle. We went to a lot of art openings and ate vegan dim sum in Chinatown.
